---
title: "In-class Exercise 04"
format:
  html:
    code-fold: true
    code-summary: "Show the code"

execute: 
  eval: true
  echo: true
  warning: false
  freeze: true
date: "2024-02-24"
---


Install and load R packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, spdep, tmap, tidyverse, knitr, GWmodel)
```
:::


Import shape file into R environment


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", layer="Hunan")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Reading layer `Hunan' from data source 
  `C:\j00b00\IS415-GAA\In-class_EX\In-class_Ex04\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```
:::
:::


Import CSV file into R environment


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
```
:::


Perform relation join (left-join) select function -\> only choice the column needed


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- left_join(hunan,hunan2012) %>%
  select(1:4,7,15)
```
:::


Working with Geographically Weighted Summary Statistics (GWSS)


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_sp <- hunan %>% as_Spatial()
```
:::


bw = 6 as in 6 neighbor when adaptive = TRUE use distance, adaptive = FALSE


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gwstat <- gwss(data = hunan_sp,
               vars = "GDPPC",
               bw = 6,
               kernel = "bisquare",
               adaptive = TRUE,
               longlat = T)
```
:::
